name: Almost Golfing
author: KesieV
description:
When I was 7 I used to watch an anime on TV called 'Tutti in campo con Lotti' (Ashita tenki ni naare by Tetsuya Chiba, A Great Super Shot Boy in English) in which the main character become a pro golfer by chance. Every episode ended with a very short and pleasant golf lesson, In which you could learn golf terminology, rules and practices.

Despite I wasn't in golfing (and I'm not in still now), I loved that part for some reasons and, thinking about that nowadays, I'm surprised on how much 'unwanted knowledge' we come across daily.

Most of the gamers knows what an 'Uzi' is and how a 'Claymore' works, despite is military knowledge, we've learned from CSI and the following crime novels that 'UV lamps' can detect body fluids, which is forensics knowledge. What's fascinating is that that knowledge is naturally submerged into fake concepts we assimilate in the same way: hacking happens via computers but definitely not with the ease shown in movies, scientists applying the Schrodinger Cat paradox is cool but that's still a (quite far) theory for now and historical monuments weren't built to be easily climbable as shown in Assassin's Creed videogames.

Fake things and real things are always mixed together and both of them are worthy to be remembered but it's up to us measure and check what is good and what is too good to be true. After all, humans, wasn't always like that? Now you've the tools for doing it in the right way!

Plot!

Now is your chance to win the Golfing Tournament and be the real champion! Keep your eyes peeled: always check the wind, avoid water hazards, bunkers, forests and mountains, and be the winner! Use LEFT/RIGHT for aiming, UP/DOWN for switching club. Hit the A BUTTON for shooting: when the indicator goes up you can decide the stroke power hitting the A BUTTON again and when it goes down you can decide its height hitting the A BUTTON once more.
